description: Delete walls and/or facets. If neither the walls nor facets keywords are given, then facets are deleted. When facets are deleted, walls without facets are automatically deleted as well.

keywords.name: facets
keywords.description: Delete facets. Walls without facets are automatically deleted

examples.description: Delete all facets (and thus all walls, since walls without facets are deleted)
Delete the wall facet with ID 4

examples.command: wall delete walls range set name 'topBottom'

examples.description: Delete the entire wall with ID 3

examples.command: wall delete range set id 1 2 not
examples.description: Delete all walls except those with IDs 1 and 2

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Wall.delete() or Facet.delete() methods - requires iteration: for w in itasca.wall.list(): w.delete() or for f in itasca.wall.facet.list(): f.delete()
